meanings.sent1: She reshaped the clay into a new design.
meanings.sent2: The artist reshaped the sculpture to make it more modern.
meanings.sent3: He reshaped the sandcastle into a miniature city.
meanings.sent4: The storm reshaped the coastline, altering its appearance.
meanings.sent5: The tailor reshaped the dress to fit perfectly.

meanings.definition: To give a new form or structure to.
meanings.sent1: The architect reshaped the building plans to include more windows.
meanings.sent2: The chef reshaped the dough into a heart for Valentine's Day.
meanings.sent3: She reshaped the cookie cutter to create a unique shape.
meanings.sent4: The gardener reshaped the bushes into animal figures.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reshaped the lesson to make it more engaging.
